definition: teaching by example beats explaining in words (idiom)/action speaks louder than words
pinyin: shen1 jiao4 sheng4 yu2 yan2 jiao4

definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
to teach by words and example (idiom)
Explaining in words is not as good as teaching by example (idiom). Action speaks louder than words.
pinyin: yan2 jiao4 bu4 ru2 shen1 jiao4

definition: to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
of all virtues filial piety is most important (idiom)
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

definition: to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
lit. teacher for one day, father for ever (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 ri4 wei2 shi1 , zhong1 shen1 wei2 fu4

definition: see a worthy, think to imitate (idiom, from Analects); emulate the virtuous/Follow the example of a virtuous and wise teacher.
